radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is dilated to 13 mm, is fluid filled, and has a hyperemic wall. There is no evidence of perforation or abscess. Trace bibasilar dependent atelectasis. The lung bases are otherwise clear. No pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver, gallbladder, bile ducts, pancreas, spleen, kidneys, ureters, stomach, small and large bowel are normal.
